column4: Can anybody help me on line 7 in http://paste.ubuntu.com/270945/ ?
/join #bash
you probably just want to redirect output to /dev/null, but they'll have better advice for you
iirc wicd's dbus interface has some methods for that...
i need to run it on ubuntu server
ok?
wicd doesn't require gtk...
uh? are we talking about the same wicd?
you're thinking of the gtk client
i guess...
the daemon has no gui
and there is a curses client.  Anyway I don't even remember if the dbus interface does exactly what you asked but you've been asking for a while and I remember something like that
http://www.linux.com/archive/feature/52443 mentions max.  Worst case scenario you could grep the source and write your own
http://www.noc.ucf.edu/Tools/Iperf/default.htm there you go
thatr's not what i mean. That is my current speed, not my max speed. I want to know how close to the 25 mbit i can get
it says it can show max.
why do you want to do this?
I need to test my internet connection using a cron job. Fully automated and quiet.
yes.  Why?
'cause i need to...
ok... well good luck I guess
erm, abort it, check file size, divide by 3?
i'm quite stupid. Thanks for this brilliant insight!
